content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"As you have already learnt, Cerner builds their foundation of intelligent solutions for the health care industry. It is of great importance for us to deliver the best results to the customer, and that is one of the reasons why we should know how this industry operates. If you didn’t have experience with the U.S. health care system, the below materials will guide you through the process and main aspects of it.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"U.S. Healthcare System Overview\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#9BC837\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The U.S. health care system is not a universally accessible system – it is a publicly and privately-funded patchwork of fragmented systems and programs. Insured people are covered by both public and private health insurance, with a majority covered by private insurance plans through their employers. Sounds complicated to you? This 8 minutes video below will help you get a better understanding about how it works!\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMHxxvbzFqc\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Healthcare System Overview\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"U.S. Healthcare Electronic Health Records (EHR)\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#9BC837\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Electronic Health Records\\r\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"An Electronic Health Record (EHR) is an electronic version of a patient’s medical history, that is maintained by the provider over time, and may include all of the key administrative clinical data relevant to that persons care under a particular provider, including demographics, progress notes, problems, medications, vital signs, past medical history, immunizations, laboratory data and radiology reports   The EHR automates access to information and has the potential to streamline the clinician's workflow.  The EHR also has the ability to support other care-related activities directly or indirectly through various interfaces, including evidence-based decision support, quality management, and outcomes reporting. EHRs are the next step in the continued progress of healthcare that can strengthen the relationship between patients and clinicians.  The data, and the timeliness and availability of it, will enable providers to make better decisions and provide better care. For example, the EHR can improve patient care by:\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"•\\tReducing the incidence of medical error by improving the accuracy and clarity of medical records.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"•\\tMaking the health information available, reducing duplication of tests, reducing delays in treatment, and patients well informed to take better decisions.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"•\\tReducing medical error by improving the accuracy and clarity of medical records.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"CMS Overview of EHR\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"iframe\",\"data\":{\"size\":329154,\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/77ab5b28-0b88-4f34-b5de-75d539c2b76e/EHRProviderFS121115.pdf?preview=true\",\"path\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/77ab5b28-0b88-4f34-b5de-75d539c2b76e/EHRProviderFS121115.pdf?preview=true\",\"fileName\":\"EHRProviderFS121115.pdf\",\"name\":\"EHRProviderFS121115.pdf\",\"mimeType\":{\"type\":\"application\",\"subtype\":\"pdf\",\"parameters\":{},\"qualityValue\":1,\"concrete\":true,\"wildcardType\":false,\"wildcardSubtype\":false,\"charset\":null},\"type\":\"iframe\",\"id\":\"77ab5b28-0b88-4f34-b5de-75d539c2b76e\",\"extension\":\"pdf\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EHR Market\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The global Electronic Health Records market size was estimated at USD 20.55 billion in 2016. The rising demand for streamlining electronic healthcare systems along with technological advancements in the field of healthcare information technology (IT) is expected to be a key factor contributing to the market growth. In addition, government initiatives promoting EHR are likely to accentuate the demand for electronic systems. To learn more about the HER Market, please, follow the \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://www.grandviewresearch.com/industry-analysis/electronic-health-records-ehr-market?utm_source=google&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=AdWords_Electronic-Health-Records-Market_Type1_Healthcare&gclid=Cj0KCQjw0rr4BRCtARIsAB0_48OPwKESFP4lQOQ1vQZmLpR5nTM0RvXHAlJ5OQe6QIIE8YhMzqP5UbwaAkZfEALw_wcB\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"link\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\".\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
